clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For topical application in the treatment of tinea pedis tinea cruris and tinea corporis caused by i Trichophyton rubrum i i Trichophyton mentagrophytes i i Trichophyton tonsurans i i Microsporum canis i i Microsporum audouini i i Microsporum gypseum i and i Epidermophyton floccosum i in the treatment of cutaneous candidiasis and in the treatment of tinea versicolor

contraindications.disease: Overdosage of econazole in humans has not been reported to date In mice rats guinea pigs and dogs the oral LD 50 values were found to be 462 668 272 and 160 mg kg respectively
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Econazole is an antifungal medication related to fluconazole Diflucan ketoconazole Nizoral itraconazole Sporanox and clotrimazole Lotrimin Mycelex Econazole prevents fungal organisms from producing vital substances required for growth and function This medication is effective only for infections caused by fungal organisms It will not work for bacterial or viral infections

incompatibilities.description: The metabolism of Pexidartinib can be decreased when combined with Econazole
The serum concentration of Pretomanid can be increased when it is combined with Econazole
The metabolism of Entrectinib can be decreased when combined with Econazole
The serum concentration of Lefamulin can be increased when it is combined with Econazole
